text: Bomber. Pours orange with a white head and sweet, malty aroma. Taste is of malt and caramel along with finishing biscuit and bready notes into the finish.

On the patio with Z, pours a rusty orange color with a small beige head. Nose is sweet malt , toffee , and caramel . Taste is caramel and malt as well and sweet. Finishes sweetly on the very same tasting notes . Quaff Score 7 / 10

Pour on tap, hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of bread, dough, yeast, lots of sweet orange and fruity notes with some honey, slight herbal notes as well. Taste was a mix of herbal, grassy, doughy notes with a hint of honey, slight biscuit, finishing fairly sweet, slightly bitter as well.

2007 bottle thanks to Homer321. Rotbox special. Pours a dark burnt orange appearance with a thin brown head. Dusty, cardboard, orange bitters, and earth in the nose. Twangy and gooey. Molasses and caramel. Some spice. Lots of oxidation. Do not pete!

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy light amber golden color with a thin off white head. Aroma is light caramel malts, slightly nutty, not much hops. Flavor is mildly sweet, mildly nutty, classic pilsner taste. Light to medium in body, but drinkable. Not too bad. Not my style.

Note: My rating is for a Tequila barreled version. 

Pours red/orange with no head at all. Aroma is oak, tequila, alcohol. Taste is overwhelming tequila/wood....I felt like I was doing a shot of below-average tequila. Some of the pilsner sneaks through...you get apple and pear, lots of the barrel, big alcohol heat. In the end, too much booziness to save this one.
Really dank and bitter! Full bodied, hazy golden color. Lots of malt and grain in the smell and taste. Hops are present but not overwhelming.
Had during a bottle share at Pinglehead Brewing in Orange Park, Fl. Solid feeling beer with nice depth but boozy finish.
Opaque orange gold w/ off-white head. Bread, toffee & light hop aromas. Biscuit, caramel & ethanol flavors. Big flavorful pilsner.
9/13/2012. From bottle. Pours golden color with a white head. Aromas of malt, hay, yeast, hops and light fruit. Caramel and bready flavors. A bit too much alcohol for my taste.

Bomber. Sweet malty nose with a dash of lemony citrus, light earthy hops and caramel, touch of dough. Pours rich deep golden with a fizzy off-white head. Heavier dough in the mouth, a little spice and even some off-putting booze levels. Faintly herbal touch on the herbal hops, bready finish under the pils malt and booze. Full body, smooth. Not bad, but reminds of the very good reason pilsners should stay around 5%.
Bottle.  Clear orange yellow pour, with a white head.  Sweet malt, doughy, sugary, fairly hoppy, bitterness, and light citrus.  A little bit boozy.  Definitely tastes like an imp pilsner.

Bottle from Alex, shared at Oakquinox 2013. Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Sweet bready malt, some sugar, and grain. Floral hops, mild citrus, and some grass. Theres a lot of sweet bready malt flavor. A touch of biscuit, some sugar, and light fruits. Floral and grassy hops with a hint of citrus. Minimal bitterness on the finish.

Caramel, toast, and subtle earthy hops on the nose.  Clear orange-gold with a quickly fading, off-white head.  Slightly sweet with some grassy tones, and a light bitterness.  Light-medium bodied with low carbonation, and nutty malt and floral hop flavors lingering.
Lots of malt, light head, amazing color. Nice palate. Tastes of sugar. Nice and crisp.

Pours a hazy orange yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma of bananas and light grain. Mouthfeel is thick and smooth. Taste is malty sweet up front followed by a sharp peppery bitterness that eventually yields to a slight alcohol taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Total Wine, Fairfax 650ml ($3): Pours a orange color with a white head. Aroma is loads of hops, along with a whiff of strong lager smell, a bit of sugar, and a hint of booze. Taste is clearly a strong lager. It aint as clean as My Antonia, but the lack of refinement makes it a better beer. Nice amount of hoppiness, way more than most any other similar beer. Easy enough to drink, but it reminds you of each sip. Good stuff.

Bomber from mixmasterob. Huge thanks for a hoppy ale. Pours hazy orange gold with a slight white head. Interesting mixed aroma - sort of bready citrus with some spicey notes. Med body. Flavor is bready with lots and lots of hop. Not NW harsh. Probably Right Coast Style. Wait. This isnt a DIPA. Or is it? Damn but this is one hoppy, tasty brew.

Bottle. Pours hazy light gold with a slight white head and medium lacing. Aroma is slightly bready and citrusy. Taste is very bready and surprisingly  bit funky. Dont think its there...but almost tastes bretty. Very resiny, sweet sticky mouthfeel. Nice citrus and bitter bite but a fair amount of yeast/malt balance.
Had this one on election night. Bright and hoppy on the nose. Very crisp and clean.  Not and outstanding beer, but still very tasty.
Bread and hay nose.  Bright golden with a rocky white head. Balanced toward bitter. Crisp and dry.
Pours clear dark golden color with white head. Aromas of cereal grains, saez hops and some citrus. Tastes like an overly sweet pilsner with caramel. Medium body with average carbonation.
Gift from SJ. This is a good brew. Nice grass and pine notes. Some sugar and bite in the finish. The alcohol ration was blended pretty good.
22oz bottle-offwhite-gold.  A-sage, spice/some orange, lt malt.  T-sweet lt malt, sage, spice/some orange hops.
Bomber. Super bright rich golden yellow pour with a spotty white head. Nice dense palate with lots of citrus overtones. Good brew.
Bottle poured into glass. Lots of hoppy characters dancing around, in both the aroma and flavor. Didnt really strike me as pilsner but more like a IPA to be truthful.
Hazy golden color in the glass. Grassy hop and sweet malt aroma. Rich mouthfeel with pleasant balance between the malt and hops.

Really good. Roasted malts give nicely to citrus hops. Very well balanced.  Good pilsner.        

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange-golden color with a moderate white head. I get very little smell off this. Taste is a little hoppy with some floral notes to it. Weird feel to it, like its almost oily.
Had this at the 2012 Great American Beer Fest in Denver, Colorado. Almost get a carrot like scent, taste tomato//carrot soup.

Bottle. Hazy gold pour with a short white head. Aroma is floral hops, citrus fruit, grassy hops, and bready malts. Taste is floral hops, toasted malt, grassy hops, light lemon, more citrus and herbal notes. Body is medium with a moderate, fizzy carbonation. Finishes with more herbal and floral hops, citrus fruit, toasted malt, light lemon, cut grass and light aspirin during the finish.

Good sized bright white head of fine bubbles with light carbonation.  Typical pilsner aroma with some spicy hops, corn flakes, cardboard and some pale malts.  Color is a bright golden orange.  Nice hoppy flavor with some floral and piney hops, more light malts and some cereal grains along with a bit of dry straw.  Light alcohol presence for an 8+ abv brew.  Finishes dry and a bitter with a bit of soft malts.  A decent imperial pilsner.  Another solid brew from Terrapin.

Fresh bomber.  Missed out on the original batch.  Pours a cloudy orange color and a medium white head. The aroma is quite nice; light fruitiness, sweet, crisp malts,  nice saaz hop presence.  The flavour is much of the same with some of the booze being known.  Sweet sugary and caramel touches.  Enjoyable, but still prefer the nonimperial versions of this style.

9/23/12. 22oz bomber from Grassroots. Very lightly hazed golden pour with a nice off-white head. Huge fruity aroma with lots of orange peel, tangerine, and grapefruit with some grainy pilsner malt aspects, bubblegum, and sweet sugars. Big sweet, fruity flavor as well, again loaded with orange and grapefruit, followed by pale malts and touches of sugar. Not bad, but sweeter and fruitier than I was expecting.

22 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Yellowish-orange pour with a white head.  Aroma of lemon zest and light pine with pilsner malts creeping up in the background.  The taste is true to the aroma and tastes much like a pilsner only more bitter, hoppier, and maltier.  The end result is a decent beer.
Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with thin white head and moderate lacing. Aroma is sweet corn malts and hops. Taste is a bitter pilsener. Decent, but not sure I would have more than one.

Bottle.  Dark golden pour with just a little head.  Try as I might, I cant draw much of an odor from this at all.  This drinks with an almost malt liquorish character ... stark corny malt up front, bitter and astringent as it finishes, exhibiting its 8.9%.  Interesting ... refreshing and dangerous all at once.  (#4782, 9/16/2012)

22 oz. bottle. Pours a fairly deep gold color with a small, bubbly head. The aroma is oranges, honeysuckle, pine sap, and butterscotch. The flavor is crisp bitterness, with a nice, mild, malt backbone. The palate is medium to heavy, very sticky and astringent, grainy, and clingy. The aftertaste is long and relatively unpleasantly bitter. Overall, this is very hoppy for a pilsener, but not very hoppy for a Terrapin beer.

10oz on tap at Beer Run, enjoyed with a nice Sunday brunch with friends. Hazy cool golden color. nice foamy off-white head. Good more full lace. Smooth lighter carbonation, dry finish. Impressive, interesting aroma. Pine, grass, hops. Good light bitterness. Nice lack of a bite. Good to sip on with my breakfast croissant sandwich. Impressive imperial pils.
Pours an orange clear color with a white head. Smells of some hops. Pretty tasty beer.

Garbage disposal and whole lemon nose, lots of lemon zest. Hazy amber, thin head. Strong overripe lemon and grapefruit flavor, but pears enter at midpalate. Finishes with light babyfood banana. Pilsner? Imperial I get; this is a strong beer, but there is no pilsner character. Its a decent beer, albeit with some minor issues, but strange hopping for a pils of any sort. Odd beer.
16 oz draft pours a clear golden color with a nice white head.  Aromas of bread, spice, pepper.  Light bodied with a sweat finish, nice.

Bomber.  I actually missed out on trying this way back when.  Im glad to see Terrapin releasing this as part of their limited election year vote for retired beers.  This pours a dark gold color with a thin off-white head that lasts.  The lacing is spotty but consistent.  The scent shows a mix of straw, grass, earthy notes, pils malt, and baked goods.  This is actually fairly clean and refreshing for the style; theres just a bit of alcohol sting that starts to show in the finish.  Bready malt flavor stands out here, with sharp bitter hops, and some grass.  The pils malt lingers a while along with the alcohol in the finish.  This is a pretty good beer but not great.  As the case with many in the style, just a tick lower abv (1%) and I think it would be even better.

Bomber from Beer Run. Pours a clear golden amber color with a fizzy white head that quickly fades. Aroma of spicy, peppery hops, pale malts, spice, bread, apples. The taste is grainy malts, apples, caramel and spicy hops. Medium bodied and refreshing. Nice beer.

32oz growler from Moondog- Marietta, GA----> mug.  Pours dark yellow with fizzy white head that disappears quickly leaving moderate lacing.  Aroma is sweet grain and lemon.  Taste is grainy citrus with a small alcohol bite.  Could stand a little more carbonation.  Overall fairly satisfying for a style I dont particularly seek out.

Pours clear orange with a fair sized white head. Smells citrusy and spicy, like a bold IIPA or a rye beer. Taste is bitter, citrus, spicy, and mildly funky. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Terrapin All-American Imperial Pilsner finishes with some spice, bitterness, and funk.

This brew stands out in the yore echelon of imperial pilasters. While most are overpowering, the all-American pilsner is always refreshing and smooth. Hints of hops with the sweetness of a pilsner. Best I've had in the category.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear golden pour with a small white head. Nice, clean aroma full of spicy Saaz hops and grainy, bready malt. Flavors were super crisp and clean. Lots of earthy and spicy hop flavors with a lightly sweetened malty finish. Crisp finish. Slight bitterness. I liked this a lot.

On tap at the Terrapin brewery. Hazy gold with one-inch white head that sticks around. Bready notes, some balanced hops, slight caramel malt. Floral on the tongue, more hops, crisp finish. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Nice try.
Ive had this a number of times. Had an aged bottle last night. Still malty as hell. Sweet but not too alcoholly. The hops have long since faded away to no great surprise. Very drinkable still.
Bottle found in Tampa. Pours a cloudy orange with swirls. Scent is citrus and a hint of booze. Taste is hoppy then fruity with a dry finish. For a 2007 release I am sure it was much better fresh.

Poured from 2007 vintage keg on-tap at Bocktown.

A-Body is a slightly translucent golden hue. Served with an approximately 1 finger creamy white head which has pretty nice retention before fading to a very thick collar and traces of lacing are left all the way down the glass.

S-Lots of pale malt comes through initially with a slight edge of German hops at the end a just a touch of phenols. Smell is somewhat subtle and rings through like a typical German Pilsner.

T- Flavor is much like the taste-only less subtle. The initial taste is loaded with pale malt sweetness and just a touch of alcohol. The hops really come through for the finish but are a touch more bitter but less biting then I am sure this was when it was fresh. Finish is pretty clean leaving nothing to linger.

P- Wow. This is great. Nice medium weight, very smooth, oily body and medium carbonation. Wouldnt have expected this much from a Pilsner.

O- This is good, crisp, and refreshing- but not my favorite of the style. The ABV is somewhat noticeable but still subdued. Looking forward to trying a fresh batch in the summer.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 02-09-2009 14:10:43
Pours very hazy orange with a medium sized beige head. Aroma of toffee, honey, berry and toasted malt. Taste is bitter hops balanced well with malt. Roasty malt finish. Smooth.

(br-btl rd-lbl, all USA ingredients, aged 1 year, 7.5%)

hzy-gl, thin-wh-head, §eff, §co2, full-body.

bright-fruit sweet-crml-malt §hefe-weizen aroma.

^fruity-hefe T1, hefe §alchl hop-resin T2, §sweet-malt sticky-hop T3.

^drinkable, ^alchl session, ties SN Harvest as best "vinyl-hop" beer @ 300 ratings.

A: Pours a nice murky orange color with a nice little head.

S: Nice sweet citrus aroma. I can pick out grapefruit and orange zest in the nose. There is a cotton candy like sweetness in the background which pulls it all together.

T: Where this beer shines is in the taste. Nice sweet caramel flavor with hints of cane sugar. There is some zip in the finish coming out mostly in the flavor of grapefruit.

M: It finishes crisp and clean with a hint of bite from the hops.

Pours a lasting ring of beige head with a golden-amber body with particulates.  Aromas of muted floral and citrus hops.  Muted citrus and floral hops, butter toffee flavors.  Finish is bitter and a little sticky.
2006 Bottle courtesy of Butters Last Supper Tasting. Pours a cloudy deep orange with plenty of floaters and white head. Aroma of sweet malts, honey, sugar candy.  Similar taste, hoppy finish.

2006 vintage thanks to unclemattie. Pours a cloudy orange color with lots of particulates and a medium white head. The aroma is awesome; sweet barley wine type notes, caramel, fruit and light malts and sugars. The flavor is basically the same; rich caramel covered sweet fruits, light alcohol and sugars. I enjoyed this brew a lot.
Poured yellow with a white head. Aroma of candy and fruit. Some pine and lemon flavor with a candy and booze finish.

On tap at the Terripin 7th Anniversary.  Pours a viscous yellow with a white head.  Aromas are strong grain, toffee, hops and lemon.  Flavor is strong, with a nice, and well balanced, alcohol kick.  Hops and grain are dominant in many different ways.  Theres a lot going on in here.  Pretty damn good Imperial Pilsner.

Bottle thanks to nearbeer.  2007 Bottle.  Pours a thick syrupy looking copper orange with a beige head.  Big caramel, toffee malt aroma, honey, the hops seemed to have disappeared leaving only a light grassy note.  Taste is very bready caramel malt, light alcohol warmth, a lot like what I remember Sam Adams Imperial Pilsner being.

I dont know what this is but not a Pilsner!! In todays beer world it is hard to FU a beer but they found a way. Had a sweet tast of honey and very hoppy. Take the name Pilsner off and call it Hopping Honey.
Golden copper pour with white head. Nose of hops and sweet grains. Flavor was hoppy, sweet and bready. Good beer.
Bottle shared by wolf. Murky orange in color, decent head. Taste was malty and sugary. To one dimensional. Not balanced and kind of a boring beer.

Bottle thanks to Springslicker. Enjoyed. Aroma was of hops, and malt. Poured copper color with whit head. Taste was similar and  and tasted more like a barley wine. Enjoyed and wish i had more. Thanks.

Draft  pours a hazy copper with a white head.  Has a good hoppy citrus aroma.  Taste is slightly hoppy but with nice tones of sweetness.  Has a good mouthfeel and a good carbination.  A medium body.  Has a great bitter finish.  A very good beer.

On tap at Bocktown. Nice beer, but the aroma is very deceiving. The aroma was strong and hoppy. I thought this was an IPA by the strong citrus notes. Pour was a very bubble orange with a one finger off white head. Taste started out prickly and biting like there were some hops coming but after the swallow turned sugary sweet. There are few beers that Ive had that made this dramatic of a turnaround in flavor. If this beer would have finished dry and bitter it would have been in the 4s. Good beer but not great.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle.  Floral hoppy aroma with lots of malt and alcohol.  Hazy orange body, small head.  This is a very big beer...perhaps too big, as the hops, malts, and high alcohol all threaten to be overwhelming.  There is absolutely no subtlety here at all.  Not bad, but one would definitely need to be in the mood.

On tap at Terrapin brewery.  A good offering, though not my favorite from Terrapin.  Being a fan of Pilsners in general, I felt for once that Terrapin overhopped the beer this time and changed the profile too far away from being a Pilsner.  With that said, I found the sweet taste up front followed by the strong hops to be an interesting blend of tastes.

12 oz bottle from Sheps Deli (St. Pete FL). Pours a dark hazy copper color with a thin white head that settles quickly and provides little lacing. Aroma is honey, spice, hops, some slight sweet malt and grass. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of honey and spice, some hoppy bitterness and slight hints of fresh hay. Generally light to medium body with a slightly sweet, slightly bitter finish.

TN tasting at maniac’s. 2006 bottle.  Pours a dark gold with thin off white head.  Nose of honey and sweet hops.  Flavor is lots of honey.  Almost all the hops have fallen out of this one.  But still a decent drink.

Bottle 355ml.Clear medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, toasted, caramel, moderate to light heavy hoppy, orange, hay, stable. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (050908)

Vintage 07, drunken ultimo Oct. 08. Trade with Fonefan. It’s a beautiful warm orange beer and the head is rather small. The aroma has notes of malt, toffee, grass, a little resin and some orange citrus fruits. The flavour has sweetness and notes of malt, caramel, orange citrus fruits, melon, grass and slightly dry citrus in the finish, that is very long. It’s very full bodied and it’s good, but something in the balance is IMO not quite right.

07 bottle.
Pours hazy orange with white head.
roma is sweet honey and grains.
Taste, honey, good dose of alcohol, fruity and some caramel malts.
Very sweet, and got thicker with time, maybe a little too much.

2007 vintage.  12oz from kpresley77.  In an effort to drink ever beer that came in a trade from the day before, all in one shot, i’m drinking this beer.  Pours orange with a bright white head.  Nose is malty with a number of compelling notes.  Taste is sweet and nice full of caramel and malt.  Bit of hop bitterness.  This is nice.

For a Pilsner this one got my attention.  It pours a golden color with a floral, hoppy, grassy, malty aroma.  Hardcore malt, dry spice, and earth in the flavor.  Dry hoppy finish with a slight cereal flavor.

Good looking ornage copper brew wth a sturdy head.  Not a too powerful aroma, but a decent caramel, vanilla scents coupled witha dusty hop backdrop.  A thinner body doesn’treally come back around on the palate.  Very easy to drink and the alcohol is well disguised. This would be a nice quencher with something spicy.

12 fl oz bottle. Pours slight cloudy orange with a lacing white head. Aroma dense malty and fruity aroma. Sweet malty and towards fruity with a mild spice note and solid fruity hoppy accent. Caramelish and hoppy into the finish.
Botella. Hazy golden thin amber. Sweet malty caramel fruity aroma. Good soft mouthfeel. The flavour is sweet and fruity with caramel, malt, and a pleasant bitterness.
Cloudy golden with medium off white head. Sweet fruity aroma with hoppy and caramel notes. Sweet flavour with caramel, hops and citric notes. Ends bitter.

I thought this beer was excellent.  Single 12 ozer poured into an imperial pint glass.  Poured a hazy gold color with a three finger white head.  Lacing was high.  Aroma was of spices and malt.  Taste is malt with a dry finish, a little flavor of alcohol.  Well balanced.  Medium body with medium carbonation.

bottle from ’07, about a year old.  pours a hazy golden red.  aroma is spicy and sweet with slight alcohol.  taste is the same with a slight tart and drying finish.  This beer smells incredible and tastes very good.  The hops and malt are in good balance.  I would never have guessed this to be 75 IBU.

Bottle from gunhaver. Thanks man! Pours a hazy golden tone with a bubbly white head. The aroma is strong and sweet with a ton of bread and grain, as well as a good deal of grassy hops. This was the 2007 edition, so it had some age on it. Cloying sweetness mixed with a huge grassy presence made for an unpleasant flavor experience. It was just way too sweet and the hops were not enough to balance. Alcohol is almost strong. I had a hard time drinking this.

Appearance: Clear, bright, golden-copper body with a thin, white head which deposited significant amounts of lacing on the way down.

Smell: Pale malts, slightly grainy, and with a light caramel scent. Floral, spicy, even citrus-packed hops arrive but soon yield to a background note of booze.

Taste: Pale maltiness with a touch of caramel sweetness. Ugh, theres that booze already. Spicy, floral, citrusy hops with a resounded bitterness which coasts along until well beyond the dry hop smack on the finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium carbonation. Somewhat sticky mouthfeel.

Drinkability: In all honesty, Ive never been a fan of this beer, try as I might. The various components dont come together to form anything cohesive or really all that refreshing, as it is more than a chore to finish on a hot summers day in Atlanta.

On tap at Trappeze.  Appears gold with a small beige head.  Aroma is not like any pils I’ve had before.  There’s a good amount of hop, some fruit.  Taste is also hoppy, grainy, and a little spiced (hops).  Mouth is sticky with some carbonation, though less than most of this style.  Overall, a very enjoyable brew.

Pours a hazy golden with a small bubbly head that lingers for a while leaving decent lacing. The smell is mostly a sweet malt aroma with caramel and a decent citrus hop aroma as well. The taste also starts with the sweet malts with some spiciness in the middle before a citrus hop bitterness in the finish. The mouthfeel is a little low on carbonation and a little sticky and thick for a pilsner. This is a decent brew but I’m not exactly sure what to expect from the style.

6-29-08 bottle shared with lb4lb thanks to emacgee 
Clear orange with a small off-white head.  Smell is super funky!  Flavor is funky oranges and garbage.  Not enjoyable.  Medium carbonation and body.  Hard to swallow the funkiness here.  Just not very balanced.
Hmmm, this didn’t taste like a pils or even a lager to me. Tasted mostly like a bock. Either way, it wasn’t very good. Funky flavor with hardly any spice or hoppy flavor.

12 oz bottle. Clear golden orange. Citrusy piney hop aroma with big sweet malt raisin background. Quite bitter with sweet (almost candy sugar) backing with flavors of raisins ands plums. Full sweet creamy body well carbonated.
Finish is sweet with a good deal of residual hop bitterness. Pushing a barleywine? Very tasty.

Bottle courtesy of emacgee. Thanks!
Pours orange with a short lived white head.  Smell is honey and orange, and is quite sweet.  Taste is sweet and malty and not very pilsner like.  Some mild chalky bland hops in there and some bitterness, but the alcohol flavor cancels out and pleasant balance they brought to the table.  Just strangely sweet overall and not very enjoyable.

Good. Some of the usuall grassy pilsner taste with a lot more taste. Spicy and crisp hop taste and finish. Lightly bitter. Highly carbonated. Very drinkable for a stronger beer. No alcohol presence. Medium bodied and full flavored.
Bottle pours hazy golden. Aroma is sweet malt and some spice. Taste spicy and sweet with clean hops bitterness. Some spice finish. Not a big fan of Pilsners, but this is pretty good.
bottle, amber  colored lager with nice head, very sweet caramel flavorwith some hop bite, nice body

Big thanks to dchlema for this treat.  Nice arome of sweet caramel malts and some spicy hops.  A little cloying.   Pours amber with a light, minimal head.  Sweet, strong present right up front and dominate early, eventually leading to a clean, spiced hop finish.  An unusual beer. Starts like a DIPA, finishes like a pilsner.  Tastes good though!

12oz Bottle - Florida Trip ABC Store.  
Aroma  Nice malt and hops aroma with some spices lingering. 
Appearance  Golden in color, light head and clear. 
Flavor  Big Pilsener flavor as for an Imperial not sure I can go that far.  Strong flavors with some nice spices added.   
Palate  Good Mouthfeel, decent texture with a nice dry finish. 
Overall  This was a fun beer ti try and the flavors where intense.  I liked the high alcohol in this beer.

bottle thanks to bro swalden_28.  pours gold color with white head.  nice retention and laced the glass well.  has a strong odor of malt.  taste is sweet.  very little bitterness in the after taste.  a very well blended and nice beer.  thanks bro for the beer.

Bottle, thanks to unclemattie.
Pours a cloudy gold, white head, very nice retention. Aroma of malt and slight fruit notes. Flavor of malt, sweet, very nice, and alcohol is slightly detectable, blends in very nicely....Hops are actually not very detectable except for very well blended bitter in the end. Full bodied, medium carbonation....I liked this one! Nicely balanced beer...
Draft at the grand opening of the new brewery.  Pours a hazy, faint gold color.  Thin, white head.  Aroma of wet hay.  Sweet, floral flavor.  Peppery finish.

Thanks xnoxhatex! [07 bottle] Pours a sunburnt orange/amber, syrupy looking.  Oxidized sweet malty and grape aroma.  Malt forward flavor, the hops come off salty.  Some peach, honey, and brandy as well.  Not at all what I expect from a Imp. Pils.  Bright palate, fizzy.

12 oz bottle from 07 vintage. Clear light golden with small white head. Slight doughy, toffee, slight citrus, very oxidized. Dough, slight aged alc, dough, slight citrus, slight bitterness, a little sweet vanilla and grainess as well. Medium-thin body with slight creaminess. Nice, not overly oxidized but I would like to try this fresh.

Hazy golden-amber.  Chewy, oxidized nose with a berryish, apricotty fruitiness.  Rounded bitterness, some really cloying doughy malts.  Long, bittersweet finish in which the flavours dont really even come together.  Moreover, the hops arent terribly bright either.

Bottle:  Courtesy of imadeadguy.  Pours a cloudy orange with a minimal white head.  Pale malts, light citrus tones and smooth ?noble? hops in the nose along with this strange spiced gumdrop aroma that really invades as it warms.  Medium-light body leads to a crisp, refreshing citrus malt backbone.  Finishes mildly dry and hoppy.  Quite tasty and easy drinking, though the color threw me off a bit.
2007 bottle.  Slightly funky aroma with lots of apples.  Hazy amber appearace.  Very rich and caramely flavor with some grass.  Fairly crisp mouthfeel. Sour and funky - drinks like a DIPA.

12 oz bottle sampled at Terrapins Side Project @ Bruisin Ales.  06 bottle, aroma of sweet grape.  This beer has aged very well.  Almost taste like a barley wine.  Alcohol is present.  Pretty darn good.

One good beer from a terrific Southern brewery.  This lager has a distinct taste and one that stays pleasantly - not bitterly - with you for a little while.  But do not mistake, you get a good blast of taste as soon as it hits your lips.  I look forward to each summer when they release their latest batch and save it for as long as I can.  The one Im drinking now is my last for 2007.

12 oz bottle from artusory, thanks Ryan. Pours mostly clear orange with a small off white head.  Malty grainy aroma with notes of white grapes, raisins, honey, and cereal. Medium dry bodied with a slightly dry and bitter finish. Flavor of grains, white grape and cereal. Was expecting a little more but got a little less.

20080315  12oz bottle, shared thanks to dmac621, thanks to artusory.  I like this.  It reminds me of the Clipper City Heavy Seas which I also like maybe more than I should.  At first it seemed the saaz was underwhelming, but with time it comes across as nicely balanced with decent lingering bitterness.
Bottle from ucusty.  Pours a golden hue with an off white head.  Head does not last very long.  Little aroma and tastes like a bold pils with a nice hop character.  Very tasty.

2006 bottle from unclemattie via trade.  Thanks again!  An underrated style meets a brewer who took a chance and they created a really nice beer.  The pour was clear gold with some darker hints of orange swirling through.  A one-finger tall white head popped up but didnt offer up much lacing.  The aroma was spicy hops and some almost smoky, roasted malts.  A bit of caramel sweetness as well.  The flavor was a unique blend of the expected spicy Saaz hops with a creamy, smoky bit of malt.  Light sweetness in there too.  The mouthfeel was great, the alcohol wasnt noitced.  A neat hybrid.  Thanks Matt!

Bottle. 2007. Amber beer with a light tan head. Big caramel aroma with a bit of grass. Earthy, spicy, grassy hops with a big caramel backing. Nice cleansing bitterness. Medium bodied. Lingering caramel, grass, earth.

I was underwhelmed by this brew the first time around it, and its still my least favorite of the Terrapin "Monster" beers, but I came around... maybe it takes sixth months for this beer to mature in the bottle.  Nice head and lacing and bright golden orange pour. Doesnt have the bitterness of many pilsners Ive had.  Not sure I have the language to describe this beer.  I taste the Liberty hops.  Floral notes, hoppy, sweet... almost like a light barleywine to my tastebuds.  Nice.

(2006 bottle i got from kmweaver i believe)translucent copper with a nice white head that leaves some webbing on the glass.i pick up orange rind,hay,wheat,and lemon in the aroma.the flavor boasts much of the same with a strange gluten type aftertaste.honestly i preferred the aroma over the flavor.

2006 bottle from kp and served in a no-nik imperial pint glass: Pours a clean golden hie with a small head and spotty lace. The aroma has notes of husky grains, diacetyl, mild acidic fruit, iced tea, and light pepper esters. The taste has surprisingly held some bitterness and acidity over a layer of soft grainy malt. There is little trace of the butterscotch and corn that was found on the nose. The finish displays a touch of hop spice and mineral water. The mouth feel is lively and sharp with a dry and metallic finish. All in all not to shabby for a older bottle of "impy pils". I was sure I had rated this but guess not, good catch Keith.

12 oz bottle thanks to unclemattie. Pours hazy gold. Nose is hop, spices and malts. Mouth is very smooth, carbonated, effervescent, nosy. Taste of a hop bomb-this is a pilsener?? Similar to Sam Adams imperial pilsener. Nice beer but Im glad I shared it with a bro..
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 8, 2008 355 ml bottle from a trade with Degarth. pours a hazy orange with a small off white head. aromas are huge hops over bready malts with some alcohol. flavours are huge hops with a lovely pilsnerish malt structure. this is an amazing beer that shows more barley wine and IIPA characteristics then euro strong lager but given the intention of this brew id expect nothing else. very good brew,one of my favs!

12oz bottle from emacgee. 2007 vintage. This was quite a nice surprise. Aroma of sweet, sticky malt and lively spicy hops. Initially honey, caramel, wet grass, and just a hint of earthiness. Plenty sweet,  but theres enough tangy citrus zest to balance. Pours hazy copper.  A vigorous pour produces a nice creamy white head that quickly fades. Tangy hops and sweet malt on the tongue. Nothing too extraordinary, but balanced quite well. Honey initially, citrus zest midpalate and woody dryness on the finish. Medium to full bodied. Slightly sticky, bordering on cloying but does not distract. Surprised to see this listed as an  Euro Strong Lager.

12-oz. Medium amber with glowing caramel highlights. Light fizzy white head. Big, ripe, almost horse blankety nose--kinda crazy, with toast and biscuit in there as well. Medium, fizzy body. Toast, grass, and biscuit on the mid-palate. Long, lightly resiny finish. Fun stuff.

Cloudy copper pour, small white head. Aroma is sweet, major butterscotch and corn. Flavor is the same pretty sweet with lots of butterscotch and caramel. Floral hops and citrus in there but with alow hop bitterness. The cloying sweetness is really making it not very good though, its all butterscotch.

Bottle courtesy of Unclemattie: Poured a cloudy copper/amber color with a light foamy head with minimal retention and no lacing. Aroma of sweet malt kind of took me by surprise with some dry hops. Taste is dominated by some sweet malt almost reminiscent of a barleywine with a dry hoppy finish which clash with the malt profile. Body is quite full with some average carbonation and no apparent alcohol. I didnt like the mix between the sweet malt and the hops and it is not something I would wish to try again.

Bottle. Pours golden orange with lacey white head. Aroma is very strong malt. Taste is very sweet intially backed up wit the dry hopped bite at the end. Imperial pilsner seems kind of like an oxymoron to me.
Cloudy orange amber appearance with a very small head.  Has an initial sweet flavor with a medium bitter finish.

2006 bottle... interesting to try one with some age on it. It pours a brilliant honey-gold with lots of slow bubbles that rise into a rocky off-white head. The aroma is intensely floral: rooibos tea, light mint, rhubarb, and lots of sweet malt. If I concentrate, I pick up a slight oxidized odor, but not strongly at all. The flavor is sweet honeyish malt with some lingering planty hoppiness. Theres a musty character there that makes it interesting. The finish is sweet and dusty. I then poured the rest of the bottle into the glass. Now its opaquely cloudy with lots of yeast floaties, and the aroma is a little more level. Still a pretty decent beer.

Bottle brought over by Ethan.  Thanks dude. Pours a slightly hazy orange amber with a thin white head turned lace. Nose is sugary sweet caramel malts and a heavy helping of hops. Very familiar. Flavor has more bitterness than I expected, Way too sweet like most of this style, but the bitterness in the finish helps to balance things out a bit.

Perfect looking hazy golden/orange coloured body with a large dense tan head and bunches of bubbles rising from the bottom. This is absolutely perfect in appearance. Aroma of very fresh grassy & citrus hops, a strong malt backbone, pears, apricots and some yeast. Medium-bodied; Strong alcoholic flavour up front with fresh hops noticeable as well. Pit fruit tastes remain throughout coupled with a good dose of malt. Aftertaste shows well - some alcohol but mostly mild tastes definitely having hops the strongest. Overall, a good beer for the style - a bit too much malt and alcohol, but definitely worth trying! I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Total Wine in Tampa, Florida on 13-January-2008.

The warrior hops dominate the aroma,but you can detect the sweetness of the malts here also,taste has a huge malt sweetness,  with a ton of hop flavoring and bitterness,so its an interesting brew, but to much sweet malt to be called a pilsner,totally misnamed and mis styled but a decent brew Thanks Kingpin
Hadnt had to many pilsners, but I love this one! Full of a malty hop flavor, and looks amazing! Damn good beer to shoot fireworks on New Years EVE!

Bottle courtesy of JimboWood.  Pours a super cloudy orange/brown body with a small off-white foam.  The flavor and aroma are grapefruits and pineapple syrup with a little fresh cut grass and cotton candy finish.  First sip was too sweet but that mellowed after a few minutes.
Bottle. Strong malty floral aroma and pours a nice copper color. The malt flavors are overbearing and has a sticky malt finish. Pour caliber for Terrapin, but not an awful beer.
Nice copper color with a good sized head.  Strong grapefruity like hops going on in here.  Nothing terrible here but just really not my cup of tea.

Thanks to Ty5592 for trading this to me. Pours a medium copper with a decent sized off white head. Pretty nice carbonation as well. Aroma is big sugary pineapple. malts and hops.. Flavor is bready malts, hops, grapefruit, pineapple. Nice and sticky to the palate. Finish is mildly dry and bitter. Overall this quite enjoyable. Thanks again Ty.
Pours a dark copper color with a white head. Has hints of sweet malts, yeasty, fruit, spice, tangy hops, and spice. Finishes sweet with boozy taste.

Bottle from Secret Santa.  Thanks!  Pours a hazy golden yellow with a very slight head and minimal lacing.  Aroma is mainly bready with just a hint of fruity hops.  Flavor is very much the same: grainy and grassy hops.  Slightly sweet finish.  Thanks, Santa!

Draft.  Slightly cloudy straw gold body with little head.  Aroma is high on alcohol and some sweetness.  More alcohol comes out in the flavor, with some grassy hoppiness and what I think is diacetyl.  Im not all that thrilled about this one.

Orange-red in color. Minimum head. Some lacing. Aroma is sweet molasses; a fruit I cant quite place; a tad buttery. Taste is sweet, apricot, maybe a little orange. Some diacetyl. Finishes bitter- which lingers a bit too long.  Good mouthfeel. Not bad.

12oz bottle.  Smells like cheetos for some reason.  Yeasty dried fruits in the nose.  Orange amber hazy hue with a small mostly diminishing off-white head.  Flavor is sweet and earthy with a noticeable bitterness.  Palate is very full bodied and soft.  Very thick brew that really grew on me.  Really did a good job hiding that 8%.  Takes getting used to but not bad after that.

Bottle. Poured a clear golden color with a thick white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Really nice mouthfeel. Flavor is really sweet, with an almost cider-like taste to it. Alcohol present in the aftertaste. Im usually not a fan of these imperial pilseners, but this one is pretty nice. Thanks to TheBeerCellar for this one.

Bottle- Pours a dark golden yellow, white head. Nice inviting nose of cereal and malt noses. This is the easiest to drink"imperial" pils Ive ever had. Not too sweet, not too boozy. Very plesant and could definitely get one in trouble!

liquorloft tallahassee, nose is full of sweet malt and floral hops. taste is heavy sweet malt with a powerful mess of hops, grapefruit peel. sweet caramel and earthy. finish sticks to the mouth. the beer is extremely heavy, almost like syrup.

Bottle courtesy of BigMilly8 - Thanks!  Lost about 1/4 of the bottle upon opening due to a ridiculous spillover (dont really expect that kind of action from a pilsner, whether it be imperial or not).  High level or carbonation levels off pretty quickly, body is otherwise copper in color.  Candy-like aroma...sweet and sugary, with some hints of hops in the background.  Caramely malt flavor with some orangey citrus, weak hop accents and piney flavors, though the sugary malts dominate.  Palate is very nice for a Pilsner, creamy/oily with a sweet aftertaste.  Not a bad beer by any means!  Might I add that I find it amusing that the All-American Pilsner is placed in the European Strong Lager category by ratebeer...
pours a clear copper with full fluffy white head.  sweet malty aroma.  syrupy palate with bitter finish, sweet and strong.

Cloudy orange amber.  Smell of malt, hops, grass, caramel, cotton candy and strawberries.  It almost smells like those strawberry pillow candies.  Taste of caramel, citrus, alcohol, malt, hops, pine, grass, brown sugar, cotton candy and a thick, oily bitterness that coats your mouth.  Bottle via Beerlando.

Pours with an orange-gold body topped by a thin to medium thick head with some lacing.  Its sweet and malty with a note of spice and butterscotch as well as a slight bitter grassiness.  The aroma is lacking.  Medium bodied, smooth yet warming.

Dark golden color with a light lacy tan head.  Hay and grass in the nose and some light caramel.  A little thick and sweet.  The hops are evident and flavorful, but a little over the top.  The alcohol is present and in your face.  Not great, but not bad either.

Picked up at Blackwater Brews in SC...
Appears a transparent, dark gold with a silky white head that slowly fades out into a mild cap.  Plenty of streaky lacing is left around the glass.
Smell is of malt, corn, wet hay, cornbread, brown sugar, yeasty dough, and citrus.
Flavors are that of the aromas with some brown sugar, and caramel making there presence known but still being buried by the wet hay, and cornbread.
Mouthfeel is yeasty, medium bodied, dry with a somewhat hot finish of booze.

Bottle thanks to ibrew2or3!!!  Poured a darker shade of gold with a little cloudiness, nice white head that had some staying power.  Aroma of grapefruit with some yeasty undertones along with fresh cut grass. Taste fo thick malt and moderately hoppy.  Aftertaste was very clean and slightly sweet.  A very good effort on this complex beer.

12oz bottle (2007) golden yellow pour -- little darker than a normal pilsner. Good sized white head. Hoppy, pleasant aroma. spicy, earthy, a touch of citrus-- with light sweet grain notes.  Full bodied and really smooth. Great texture.  Like this one.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of Mcbackus. Pours a golden hue with a dash of red. Small white head with a small white lace. Nose was of breadlike grains. Taste was initialy grainy and breadlike with some hoppy presence. Later into the brew there was some sweetness I could not put my finger on. Finish was typical hoppy bitterness, with the undercurrent of this sweetness. This was a good brew.

From bottle : Pours a slightly hazy amber orange color with a quick forming froathy white head that dies pretty quick and some spotty lacing.  Nutty caramel and toffee.   Flavor is nutty with sweetness.  Medium and thick in spots palate, little alcohol on the end.  Not to bad.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Liquors - 12 oz bottle. Medium orange pour, soft, somewhat quickly fading white head  - leaves sticky lacing. Syrupy, nutty aroma with some baked bread accents and a hint of wort. Nutty flavor with some sweet hints of caramel and toffee and pick up an odd flavor not too different from Terayaki sauce. Some roasted notes as well. Thickish, sticky mouthfeel. Alcohol burn is warming and nice.

Big malty aroma, with some toast and very light metal.  Borderline bad label, rusty gold brew, clingy head. This was actually surprisingly well-done.  A little briny/brothy at first, substantial mouthfeel, strongly bittered, lightly sweet, a little butter or oil flavor.  No fruit, dry-sweet like the brittle part of peanut brittle.  Long very bitter aftertaste which lingers in the top crease on your tongue.  This is worth a try.  ABC Liquors, Betton.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2011 Yellow/orangish, minimal white head, slight chill haze, gusher. Sweet pils malt up front, faint fruity esters, grass, hay. Flavor has a nice soft pils malt character, very light grass and floral hop character. Not much else. tad too sweet for a pils.
Vintage 2006. Poured gold with bubbly white head. Aroma of sweet malt and some fruit. Big sweet malt flavor backed up by alcohol. I need a new one to try.

Vintage 2007. Pours out a nice golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is buttery and hoppy. Taste is mouthful explosion of hops, grapefruit dryness, and hints of pine. It starts to easy some of the malt in there after a couple of sips. Smooth finish makes this very easy to drink, but scary because the alcohol will sneak up on you. Wonderful beer and another fine offering from Terrapin.

12 oz, 2007 vintage. Clear copper with a medium and lasting head. Aroma is honey drenched grapefruit and pine. Flavor is similar, with some slightly harsh molasses. Palate is mostly smooth and medium bodied.

12oz bottle pours a clear deep gold with thin white head. The aroma is solid pale  Munich type maltiness with mild fruitiness and light spices behind. The taste is just like the aroma with a big hit of pale like maltiness followed closely by sweet light dark fruitiness.  Midway more pale malts surface as well as some sweet caramel malts and a hint of the ABV. The finish is somewhat neutral. This beer is full bodied and full flavored. Tasty indeed.

Had this at the Emerald Coast Brew Fest in Pensacola, FL.  Poured a golden yellow almost orangey color.  White head did not last long. Aroma and Flavor are both malty with a bit of hop bite in the finish.  Hides the 8% ABV extremely well.  Decent lacing on glass.  I liked it.
Interesting pilsner, it tastes kind of like an IPA/pilsner mix.  Pretty bitter with a hint of sweetness in the finish.  Not too bad.

Golden yellow with a slightly egg shell medium head. Lots of sweetness in the aroma, some caramel mostly. The flavour did not lead on that this is 8%. While you can tell it is big, its not overwhelming. The flavour has some caramel and some pils like maltyness. Not a whole lot else to it.

Pour: crisp yellow/orange. Head: off white, thin, fizzy, laces some. Aroma: sweet, caramel malt, candy like. Flavor: roasty, bitter/waxy, caramel, malt. Palate: thick bodied and smooth. Finish: roasty.

Interesting 8.1% but you would never know it. Good Pils golden color, but the aroma is what grabbed me good and fruity good mouth feel and I love Pils anyways. Short lived head but it does leave some lacing. A winner from Athens, Georgia that is.

Bottle. Fairly dark copper color with a white head that didnt last but, did leave a good lacing. Aroma is dark roasted malt with some hop to give it balance. Flavor tastes heavily of malt with a little hop bite at the end. Altogether they hid the alcohol well. Tastes to me much like a German bockbier. Very good.

2007 bottle from ucusty. nice golden/amber color with lots of active carbonation.  aroma of sweet malt, unidentified fruit and citrus/grassy hops. flavor is caramel, malt, and sweet iced tea with resiny pine hop kick for bitterness. alcohol is present for sure but it helps tame the sweetness.

12oz bottle shared courtesy of weeare138. Vintage 2007. Poured a medium golden color with a small sized white head. Aromas of grass, toffee, and citrus. Tastes follow suit with a light fruitiness. Alcohol burn in the finish.

Poured an orange amber color with a thin, off white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of berries, straw, some cereal, and toffee malts. Taste of caramel malts, nuts, earthy yeast, with a bit of fruit, and moderate alcohol as well.

Thank to weeare138.  Pours a lightly hazy golden amber with a smaller bubbly white head.  Aroma of iced tea, sweet grains, caramel, light grassiness, citrus and hints of alcohol.  Flavor of hops, caramel, tea, sweet malts, grains, alcohol and some light bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Date: July 07, 2005
Mode: Draft
Source: Summits - Sandy Springs
Appearance: hazy dark yellow, whispy head
Aroma: sweet malt aroma
Body: good body
Flavor: big malt flavor, touch of sweetness, light bitterness

Date: August 11, 2005
Source: Wild Wing, Marietta
Aroma: sweet malt aroma covering up some crisp hops
Flavor: big sweet malt flavor with enough sharp hops to keep it in check, bitter sweet finish
Overall: not the same beer as at Summits that was too much like the Rye Squared

Date: November 05, 2005
Source: cbc
still too sweet and hot, thin, alcoholic, maybe after a couple of years it will settle down?

Date: June 26, 2006
Mode: bottle
Appearance: crystal clear gold, scant head thats hard to rouse but produces a nice bits of lace
Aroma: sweet fruity aroma with a hint of pine, sweet malt with a nice crisp hop bite, a bit hot, nice short lasting bitter edge
Overall: I still dont get it but Im not a Pilsner fan, aparently not even an American one

Date: July 22, 2006
Mode: draft
Source: twains
starting to apprecialte the hop flavor, candy sweetness in both the aroma and flavor, 

Date: July 17, 2008
Mode: bottle
Source: tasting
same candy sweetness, hops are getting better, 

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *4

2007 Vintage.  Hazy, translucent orange golden color.  Minimal white film for a head that leaves behind a dense sheet of lacing.  The body looks a little syrupy.  The aroma shows sweet pale malts, bread dough, some light fruits (maybe red apple or golden raisons).  The flavor is a bit different, showing the pale malts and the fruit, but substituting some of the dough for citrus hops.  The body is medium-full, with a cloying, sticky palate.  Goes down smooth and leaves a lingering citrus hop finish.  Nice brew, though the syrupy consistency is a bit of a turnoff.
pours clear gold with slowly disapating head and lacing.  hops up front malts and sour apple on the back.

Strong aroma of malt, then hops, orange/apricot colour, tiny off-white head.  Piney hops start, some fine malt backing it up too. Medium bodied, sweet, alcohol is subdued. A nice one, Thank You IPFreely.

This beer is a transparent dark golden amber. The strong aroma has a heavy fruity overtone, making it smell more like a cider than a beer. Flavor is more fruity than malty, rather like apple juice with a nice alcohol bite, rather like a good hard cider. Smooth and a little bitter, not outstanding but refreshing.

12 ounce bottle in pint glass.  Pours bright copper with lasting head and lace.  Aroma of overripe raisiny fruit, some yeastiness.   Flavors of caramel and malt disappear rapidly in clean finish.  Full-bodied with medium carbonation.   Im not a fan of "everything-imperial" but this is a pretty darn good beer.  Enjoying it with my home-made Jamaican Lamb Curry and Spicy Eggplant.  

Hmmm...not going to change my rating but, with all its fruitness and roundness, Im skeptical about whether this is truly a lager.

Draft @ Liberty Grill & Tap House (Myrtle Beach) - Dark gold, thin creamy light tan head.  Nose was loaded with sweet florals and grainy caramel, with lesser tones of booze soaked white bread.  Up front sweetness fades out into bready flowery hops with touches of earthy cereal and alcohol.  Full bodied, thick and syrupy, soft carbonation, warming, lightly bittersweet finish.  Not sessionable, but fun to drink one or two...

Poured a reddish amber and leaves a thin creamy light beige head and lace. The aroma is sweet, thick, a tad bit or alcohol shows, earthy notes, molasses, definitely malt predominant. Very impressive thick aroma. The flavor is a tad harsh from alcohol and carbonation, the aroma was far superior, some sweet molasses, and mild hops show. The palate is a tad harsh too. Finishes warm.

12oz bottle. Poured clear orange-golden, with a thick off-white head. Nice herbal, hoppy aroma. Flavor is initially malt, then piney hops take over. Hops are the focus, but supported well by malt. Really well crafted and tasty.

The aroma is strong with sweet caramel malt, citrus hops, and alcohol. The appearance is amber with a nice head. The flavor is like the aroma with a hoppy finish. The palate is super thick. I am really impressed with this beer. My only complaint is the papery aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2007 Bottle.  A nice golden colored, sweet, heavy pilsner.  Not your typical pilsner at all - hence the imperial labeling + 8% abv.  not much aroma, but very sweet.... slight alcohol burn in the end... light carbonation on the palate.  very hoppy, bitter finish, nice.  pretty darn good stuff.

On tap at the standard.  Very floral aroma and almost lilac bite to the flavor.  There was something a little off with this, whether it was the tap or the beer I am not sure.  There was a distinct bitterness and metallic flavor.  Really hit me the wrong way.  Ill be sure to give this one another try but for now the overall score is a little low due to the bite.  Nice color though.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Dark amber with an inch of head. Sweet taste and aroma. Feels syrupy in the mouth, and a bit sweet. Also the 8% feels a bit lighter than what I taste. Honestly reminds me of the DFH 120 Minute IPA, albeit not as powerful.

Bottle.  Dark gold with thin head.  A nice malty strong pilsner that reminds me of a DIPA but with slightly less hop aroma.  Not overpowering in the alcohol and sweetness.  Overall smooth drinking amped up pilsner.

Very good and strong pilsner, personally would pair it with beef.  Light hops and a nutty aroma back the scent and a light butter note rounds it out.  A nice and different offering with a bit of punch at 8%

Perhaps one of my least favorite styles. Bigger and "better."

Pours darker than I expect. more brown than golden pilsner. Fairly flat in appearance without much of a head. Nose is malty and reminds me of walking into a brewery for a tour--boiling wort and all. Husky grains. Definitely my favorite aspect of this beer.

Flavor is more malty without the biscuit crispness and hop tang of a traditional pilsner. Honestly, what makes this a double? More malt? Higher ABV? Definitely more of a malty, bready flavor and more alcohol. but not much more hops. A bit out of balance and leaning towards the malts. Crisp-ish but not light. Easy enough to drink and it packs a wallop but still not sold on this beer. Just such an odd style to get "bigger."

Bottle. Pours a clear copper with a one finger lasting off white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of sweet malt, floral, grassy, citrus, and spicy hops. Taste is sweet malt, light caramel, a hint of alcohol, and a good dose of hops. Medium mouthfeel with more focus on the malt then the bitterness and a bit of alcohol warmth as it goes down. Good.

Bottle. Im not sure what an Imperial Pilsner is supposed to be like, but this was a supprisingly tasty beer for me. Aroma has lots of caramel, pine, grapefruit and a broth note with dates pineapple and honey in the background. Head is small, fizzy, white and mostly diminishing with good lacing. Color is clear amber. Flavor is moderately sweet and slightly tart to start out and heavily sweet and lightly bitter in the long finish. Palate in med/light, oily with a lively carbonation and a slight alcohol finish. Nice beer, like a mild DIPA.

Medium sized white head, retention is good with an abundance of sticky lace. Hazy gold colored body. Nose is lightly grainy, bready with some caramel notes and lightly grassy. Body is medium with a spritely carbonation. Medium sweet pale malts, a touch toasty and grainy, grassy hops, faint citrus. Malts dominate here. Finish is lightly sweet and a bit fruity. Props to TBC2 for this one!

Rather weak smell. Didnt get much from this beer. The smell was somewhat of a weak fruity smell. Brewed in Maryland which pisses me off because this is supposed to be a local brew. The color is a lovely peachy/gold, but looks can be deceiving. The Lager color just doesnt show, which is great a twist to the lager color. Is this common with European Lagers? The hops shine through but they arent crisp. The beer is nice and smooth. I am very impressed with the smooth texture of the beer. Taste some fruit, but it is hidden so it is hard for me to determine what this fruit actually is. Also, the alochol is well hidden. The bitter flavor hits you well in the aftertaste but not as much as the beforetaste. Decent beer, keeps me guessing. I love the ABV.

Bottle(2007).  Pours a deep amber with not much head.  Nose is malty with hops lurking in the background.  Very similiar to 2IPA IMHO.  Flavor is very malty with thick, viscous fruit. Syrupu sweetness, not cloying, with hop dryness in the blend.  This is what Imperial Pilsner is supposed to be?  What happened to the Pilsner part?  The Terrapin brews seem to remain in this family and similiar mouthfeels.  It was interesting and I would like to try other interpretations of Imperial Pilsners
bottled.   A very well delieved euro. strong ale... all america sounds nice, but the style is dead on euro.  Very enjoyable w/ a crisp mouthfeel, alcohol is hidden.   Good, will rate again.

Sittin here spinnin some Dead and sippin my first All-American Pilsner of 2007. Definitely bigger and more complex than last year. Not much aroma coming through. Nice-looking clearish, deep copper color, with small white head. Interesting and unique flavors swirling in my mouth. Signature Terrapin big maltiness, and a compelling dance of hop flavors melding together quite nicely. Love the dry hopping! Some moderate lacing on the glass. I like it! Love the fact that these guys are not afraid to make tangible efforts at continually changing, updating, and improving their beers. Impressive. Keep it up guys... Thanks!

Not bad. Decent aroma. Looks like a strong beer, small head etc...Thick mouthfeel, slightly sweet, not very hoppy at all. Alcohol is well hidden. Its OK. Seems like it wants to be a barley wine but doesnt quite make it.

2006 Bottle courtesy of decaturstevo.  Thanks Steve.  Pours a slightly hazy light orange color with a minimal white head.  The aroma consists of mainly orange citrus and sweet malts.  The flavor is much of the same with a bit of bitterness in the finish (although not 75 IBUs worth).  There is no sign of the alcohol in this beer.  Medium bodied.If it were available in Ohio, I would enjoy this from time to time.

Bottled. A hazy orange beer with a light orange head. The aroma is sweet mlaty with notes of oranges. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of over ripe fruits, as well as a light metallic note of alcohol, leading to a lightly bitter end.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a off-white head. Malty, light caramel aroma and taste, sweet. Medium body with a sweet light dry finish.

Bottled. Orange coloured. Unclear. Off white small fluffy head. Ryebread, sweetness and herbs are the immdiate notes, I get from the aroma. LIght cocoa as well. Flavour of light caramel, sweetness and herbs. Medium bodied. Quite dry. Is quite bitter and light citric in the end.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Courtesy of sk8viking. Slightly hazy, pale amber golden with a small, off-white head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Quite full-bodied with sweetish, malty accents and then an alcoholic, biiter finish. Not overly refined - and so far American style Imperial pilseners have failed to impress me. 290407

Bottle. Small white fizzy head that mostly diminished. Spar lacing. Clear golden colour. Aroma was caramel, fruit, toasted, hops, herbal and light floral. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Flavour was well balanced with malty sweetness and light hoppy notes. Light bitter and slightly dry finish.

2006 bottle. Pours a cloudy, burnished copper with a thin white head. A very unplsner-like hoppy nose with a malty undercurrent and notes of biscuity yeast. Big malt flavor with a dry, grapefruity hop character. Medium-bodied. Fairly rich wit ha lingering citrusy goodness. Very impressive beer ... it blew away my expectations.

Bottle 2006 poured a clear orange amber with a minimal lingering off white head. Aromas of grain, bread, spice hops and a hint of orange. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of toasted malt, straw, carmel and a hint of earthiness with a crisp lingering moderatly bitter finish.

Big Hoppy Monster was so damn good I had to try its cousin here...I got a discounted 4. Discounted cause the freshness date expired A YEAR AGO (found out when I got home, live and learn)...dont know exactly if that matters for this style, but it definitely wasnt as good as BHM. P.S.~ Ill STILL drink the other three ofcourse.

Another one courtesy of redlight.  Thanks Brent!  Crisp, clear and golden.  White head.  Sweet and alcoholic on the nose.  Surprisingly well-played example of an imperial pilsner (whatever that means).  This didnt off-put me like Herold Golden Revolution, which tasted more like a fancified malt liqueur.  This one is more refined with a burst of grassy/floral notes that bring it down to earth and a robust hoppiness that quells the fruity malt backbone from being overly sweet and cloying.  But, still, nothing thats going to make me go out of my way for a Strong European Lager.
Sweet aroma, mostly honey, some fruitiness.  Pours pils blonde.  Smooth, malty, honey, good lager flavor, some decent hops going on.  Pretty easy to drink @ 8% abv.
Bottle.  Aroma of sweet malt, banana, citrus, pit fruit, and spices.  Taste is similar to the smells with a bitter finish.  A decent beer.

bottle: pours a nice straw colour with minimal white head. aroma of yeast and almost banana like sweetness with some honey also interesting grapefruit like hop flavour with a sweet carmally finish. a very earthy taste overall. very surprisingly good beer.

Poured a minimally hazy, orange gold.  Medium head.  Aroma is of sweet malt, caramel, floral, and some mild spice.  Flavor was heavy on the malt; started sweet, has a dry finish.  Flavors of citrus throughout; medium body.  A mild floral hop presence near the end.  Alcohol not noticable at all.  While I would have like just a little more malt, this was enjoyable.  First for the style, so I have nothing to compare it to in the same genre.  However, it is no doubt one of my favorite lagers.
Pours amber with a straw colored head.  Smells of pine, peppers, yogurt and oranges.  Tastes citrussy with a nice malt backbone.  Finishes tangy and tarte.

This pours an opaque golden color with a one finger white head. The aroma is mainly grassy. The flavor starts out slightly malty sweet but finishes dry and bitter with some lemony flavors.  Its a thirst quencher and very easy drinking.

Courtesy of goldtwins via trade
Bottle: The aroma is lightly sweet with some notes of grapefruit.  It pours a transparent orangish-gold with a moderate white head that lasts a minute or so.  The flavor starts lightly sweet with a hint of citrus and finishes with some moderate flowery hops.

[124-20061209] 355mL. Complex sweet and tangy hop aroma. Light orange body with the odd bubble and a little head. Tastes like vegimite with a potato quality, kind of like drinking steak. Medium body with a big full taste and light alcohol is noticeable. Interesting but a little offensive.

Bottle courtesy of TheBeerCellar2. Pours a clear bright copper (or is it dark gold) with a lacy white head. Aroma is sweet, with herbal hops, fruit and a honey-like caramel holding everything else up. Medium-full body with fine but full carbonation. The taste is very much the same as the nose, Clean pine-bitter finish.

The aroma was strong with caramel and a lightly spicy hop presence. Some citrus character was notable and a bit of a floral note. The golden beer was hazy and had hardly any head and practically no head retention. The flavor was quite bitter with a citrusy and spicy hop character and bittering which actually improved the beer. Some caramel was present but the hops ruled the flavor. The body was medium full and had a moderate level of carbonation. Overall the bittering was similar to that of an IPA, but the lager was never clean. A nice cooter overall, and one that actually improved over time. 12 ounce bottle, 2006 beer tour.
user_location: North of Raleigh, North Carolina, USA

text:
Pours a thick, golden/amber with a light haze and slow carbonation. A large-bubbled white head holds as a thick cap. Juicy, fruity aroma with a breadiness beneath. Peaches, pears and cherries combine in the semblance of fruit cocktail while minor aclcohol notes morph it into a liqueur. Rather lean-bodied for such a  bountiful aroma, with a dry finish to boot. Fruity flavor turns bitter with Continental-style finishing hops and notes of rye. This beer is a pleasant result based off a good concept. (Sometimes these "experiments" dont turn out so hot.) "Prost, my Chelonian brother."
<font size=-4>A tasty treat from <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-14352.htm&g Thanks, man.</font>

Pours a nice golden honey color with a nice thick frothy white head.  Bubbles galore.  Very nice smell for a pilsner.  Smells of hops, sweet malts, and citrus.  Pretty full on flavor, alcohol is masked pretty nicely.  Very easy drinking for an 8% brew.A little sweetness to it mixed in with the hops is very pleasant.  Theres a slight bitterness to it at the end, but nothing unpleasant.  Very well done IMO.
Its a lager... its a croud plesaer. Even my inlaws appreciated it. So while not overly unique, theres something for everyone here.

at first glance - it looks like a headless hefe.   poured almost no head, and takes on a golden haze.  aromas reveal a slightly hoppy forest.  also there is a sweeter malt smell will lingering sourdough.  for a pils, this is really damn good.  it even holds its own in other fields.  smooth mouthfeel with hints of alcohol.  the taste mirrors aroma, which is pleasantly surprising at the least.  the finish is bittersweet; i like it.  good lighter beer with a kick.  its also rather high in drinkability.  i wish that could factor in on the scoring system.

Bottle courtesy of Hogtown Harry.  Dark yellow, foamy white head - looks great.  Nice malt, hop, alcohol aroma.  Strong kicked up pils taste - more malt, more pils like hops, and more alcohol!  Wow, I really enjoyed this, exactly as advertised.

#991. Bottle. Thanks to whoever brought this to the White Elephant exchange at the Chicago Area gathering at Flossmoor station. Hazy orange yellow, nose thin malty with soe sour hops yet sweet and crisp. Good alcohol presence. Good.

12 oz bottle-from Secret Santa Pours a cloudy golden color w/almost no head, did have some decent lacing. Full, rich, deep,floral hop aroma. Sweet, hopped flavor up front, but not overly strong or out of balance. Has some good malt bitterness to finish it out. This one was a little more hoppy than I usually like them, but I enjoyed it. Had a better balance than on overly hopped IPA. Long finish

2006 bottle thanks to ambergirl.  Poured a hazy medium golden with a short cap of white head.  Nose picked up an array of lighter fruits upfront... sweetness laced with alcohol... some herbs and maybe a hint of candy beneath.  Flavor focused on pale and fruity malts with moderate herbal bitterness and some caramel.. alcohol was present but never got in the way.  Quite smooth on the palate with sticky sweetness lingering along with citrus and herb bitterness.  Good brew.

12 oz. bottle and on draught at Taco Mac - Lindbergh City Cen.  Pours an ever-so-slightly hazy golden orange with a medium amount of whitish crown.  Decent retention and decent lacing.  Aroma is pretty hoppy compared to a normal Pils, with good herbal, citrus, and floral tones.  Also a good amount of sweet malt and some yeast detected.  Flavour is very malty but balanced with an assertive helping of hop bitterness.  Mid-way through the tasting, caramel sweetness comes and goes, but the finish is more acerbic and bitter than smooth.  A decent hoppy aftertaste is left in the mouth, but it is more grassy than floral or citrus.  Even though its 8% ABV, you cant really detect much of an EtOH burn at the back of your throat - its really sneaky.  This is overall a nice beer, the first Imperial Pilsner Ive ever had, so I definitely need to try others to get a better feeling about the entire category, as a whole.  Im glad I have easy access to it, but to be honest, I wouldnt miss it.  Highly recommended for at least one try, though.

Pours a cloudy light orange golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma has slightly floral hops to it with hints of malt,barley and yeast.  Taste is bready and malty with hints of floral and barley undertones.  Not bad and the alcohol is hidden well.

Bottles shared with a bunch of folks at DougShoemakers Decemberfest 2006 - courtesy of IPFreely. Nice bright golden-orange with a small white head. Aroma is quite sweet, lots of caramel, with some grassy hops. Flavour follows the aroma, with some more prominent warm hop notes to finish. Body is slightly sticky. Its a nice beer, but it just doesnt seem big enough to be called "Imperial" to me, even despite the 8% abv.
Bottle. Slightly foggy orange body with a bubbly white head. The aroma is dark and caramelly, cookies, and dust. Oily hop flavour, some bread, caramel, and warming alcohol. Not too bad.

2 bottles shared with the gang at Decemberfest 2006 -- courtesy of IPFreely. Pours a clear bubbly gold with a small diminishing white head. Aroma is surprisingly sweet, theres a significant amount of sweet malt along with a good amount of hops and some caramel or toffee. Flavour of caramel malt and floral hops with a decent bitter finish. Medium bodied. Its not very Pilsner-like but I enjoyed it.

Bottle @ Dougs.  Thanks to Tim.  Gold, thin to no head.  Nose is sweet malt - almost like wort - caramel.  Flavor is caramel up front, strong but appropriate hopping, some grass.  A bit of lemony rind.

Bottle (2X 12oz).  at Decemberfest 2006 - IPFreelys bottle.  Clear gold, bubbly, with an average frothy head.  Interesting aroma - woody, dry, cereal grain malt, alcohol, musty floral hops.  Taste is also musty, slightly sour, probably from all those alphas, a lot of thick wheaty malt, finishes extremely acidic and bitter, the alcohol is sneaky too.  Chewy, grainy body, decent astringency but very acidic, alcoholic in the linger.  Very interesting, much boozier than you think.  Thanks, Tim!

Bottle @ Decemberfest.

Pours gold with small ring on top. Small foamy summit.

Rich, sweet malty aroma, clean good nose, rather low on hops to be called pilsner. (7-)

Soft, smooth body, fruity malty middle. Clean lager with late and short bitter notes. Very much like Polish Mocne, maybe a bit less alcoholic.

2006 - indicates a ABV of 7.5%/  Thanks SS. Hazy dark golden to amber color. Thick looking, somewhat cream off-white head. Light rings of lace. Fruity and herbal aromas. Has a olive oil essence that is intriguing. Citrus and apricot scent abound. Much too sweet for my liking. Soft and smooth on the palate, nearly too smooth for a pils of any sort, bit It is really smooth. Pale malt sweetness abound. A floral hops presents that adds sweetness to the mix. A fuller bodied malt liquor/euro strong lager. Still have yet to embrace this style, albeit well brewed here.

Thanks to unclemattie for the bottle. Poured a slightly hazy amber/orange with an extremely small head. Aroma is lite-sweet malt, floral hops. Taste is sweet malt, a little grain. Finishes with a balancing hop bitterness that lasts. Medium body, medium carbonation.  A unique and good beer.

Bottle Thanks to Shrubber85. 48F Lager Glass. Pours a medium yellow color, with great lacing and head. Great sweet and hoppy aroma, very nice light malts. Nice sweet begining finishing with a great hoppy but not very bitter finish. Really nice. Medium palate, good carbonation, I could easily drink this beer often unfortunately its not available here, really nice brew though.

Pours a good light orange color. The head seems to fade out quickly but if you lean your ear towards it you can hear a bit of snap, crakle, pop. I can taste a bit of the alcohol content which is a bit sweet with a sour fizzy finish to it. Seems to have some malty bock characteristics to it.

Bottle thanks to a trade with Goldtwins.  Pours a nice copper/golden color with a thin white head.  Nice noble hop aroma with a sublte sweetness.  Nice flavor, very crisp with a bit of alcohol.  Its tough for a pilsner to hide 8% ABV.  Light mouthfeel, true to the style.  Clean finish with a slight bitterness.
user_location: The Land of Milk and Honey, Ohio, USA

text: 12oz bottle via trade with CaptianCougar.  Aroma:  Medium-sweet malt with a touch of graininess.  Some light lemon, spiciness, and a good dose of floral hops.  Appearance:  Golden in color and clear.  White head was small and frothy.   Small amount of lacing.  Flavor:  Medium-High sweet maltiness with a light honey flavor.  Hops are surprising if youre expecting a traditional Pils.  Nice floral and pepperiness with a strong floral presence.  A bit of citrus lurked in there, too.  Bitterness is nice and refreshing and almost scrubs away the sweetness from the malt.  Some grassiness into the finish.  Palate:  Medium bodied.  Medium-high carbonation.  Overall:  A good beer with some nice flavors.  Alcohol is well hidden.  A little too much sweetness that lingers into the finish.

Good looking opaque golden pour...although Id like a lot mor beading to amuse myself in between sips.   Big caramel/toffee malt presence.   I was hoping for a dryer, crisper mouthfeel.  this one almost tastes like a cream ale, with a buttery smooth palate.  The hop profile seems to favor the PNW and thats OK by me. Grapefruit and citrus highlights and a bitter finish that quenches a thirst well.   The alcohol is extremely well hidden, I certainly would not have guessed anywhere near 8% ABV.   Good, but  not a great drink.  My thanks to buddy Cornfield for this sample~!
Another outstanding Terrapin Beer Company offering. Not quite as good as the other "Monster Tour" offerings but great in its own way.

12 oz bottle. Pours with a flufy frothy head that disapates into a soft top layer. Beautiful straw golden color...nice smell of malt and bread. Taste pops out with a malty topside that smooths down and drops down to give a nice softly bitter aftertaste, a bit like grass (in the good way.)

Bottle. Thanks to unclemattie! Pours a yellow/gold with a white head on top. Aroma is bready malts with hops laying in there as well, smelling sweetness also. Flavor is malty with a nice bready taste with some sweetness at first hit of the tongue. The flavor finishes off with a nice hop bitterness. Another great beer out of Terrapin that I really enjoy.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2006 Pours very clear and deep gold with a white head. The smell is thick with sweet doughy malts and a bit of fruit - almost like buttery raisin bread toast. The flavor is sweet and with a healthy flavor of floral hops and lager yeast (more like an uber-marzen than an uber-pilsner). The finish is somewhat dry with some hop bitterness. The finish isnt completely dry though thanks to the very full body of the beer. There is a hint of alcohol in the aftertaste. The beer is pretty good - but seeing the term "Imperial Pilsner" definitely had me hoping for a nose more like Dulle Tev (not a pilsner for sure - but it has an aroma that exploded with Saaz hops - Saaz being the typical hop variety in authentic Czech pilsners).

The head disappears quickly, but a steady, slow moving stream of bubbles continues upwards during the course of the drinking.  The aroma is buttered bread and a light floral hopping.  At this point it comes across more like a Premium Lager, but once in the mouth, the alcohol says, "Okay, its a European Stronmg Lager."  The flavor is sweet bready malt, a touch of corn (even though the commercial description says no adjuncts), a light floral bitterness, and a lurking alcohol presence.  Not bad.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Street Market, Raleigh, NC<font size=-1>

Bottle from TBC2: Yellow/gold with a small white head. Aroma, some floral hops, malty. Flavor, light sweet maltiness, floral bitterness, some slight breadiness as well. Pretty solid, helps that Im thirsty.

Bottle from cbkschubert. Yellow color with strong malty aroma. Thick body with rich sweet malty flavor. Mild dry hoppy finish. Did I mention that this beer was very malty?? Thanks to Craig for the bottle.

Yellow/gold, with a white head. Aromas are hops and malt, with a little bit of fruit. Flavors are fruit, hops, malt, sugar and a floral touch. Another eally nicely done brew by Terrapin. Thanks to LeopoldStoch for this bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2006 I dont know how I forgot to rate this beer!!!  Hazy golden color.  Foamy white head.  spicy malt aroma.  Lots of malt balanced with the right amount of HOPS.  Nice bitter floral finish.  PERFECT SUMMER SPECIAL!

Bottle. Poured a nice golden color with a white head that settled to a ring. Initial sniffs of dough but as it settled more malts were picked up. As it warmed the aroma went to fruits. The flavor found oranges and other citrus, floral, and a malt background. Medium body with light to medium bitterness throughout.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2009 10/08/2006: 2006 bottle from illinismitty. My first Terrapin beer - Thanks Sean! Dark golden color, clear. Lively carbonation with a foamy pale yellow head. Aroma is malt with slight citrus hop as well.  It smells strong and intiviting.  Flavor is malty, slightly sweet, and a floral/pepper/citrus hop bitterness. The alcohol is warming, but well hidden.  Finish is crisp with a very nice hoppy bitterness. Medium to full body with a slight syrup quality that has a nice coating effect and is very smooth. I really enjoyed this beer and really look forward to trying the other Terrapin beers from illinismitty (Rye Squared and Coffee Oatmeal Imperial Stout). 12 oz bottle (2006, 7.5% alcohol).2006 Vintage on 11/12/2007:  Hazy golden apricot color with a dense, foamy, beige head. Very floral aroma, hints of aged citrus; sweet toffee malt. Flavor is pleasingly sweet, caramel maltiness; extremely flavorful and balanced. Great orange and floral hoppiness.
